title: Ticket #6919: On recycle, shadow can log new job's events under old job's id
description:
IN2P3 reported an issue where the DAGMan event log occasionally shows a certain job ID executing twice, although the shadow and schedd logs clearly show the same job ID only running once.

This happens when the shadow is recycled. The BaseShadow object is deleted and a new one created. But the WriteUserLog data member (named uLog) is static, so it's left in place. If the new job doesn't require any event logging, then the initialization code for the new BaseShadow object also leaves WriteUserLog object alone. This results in events for the new job being written to the old job's event logs under the old job's id.

A comment says that the WriteUserLog object is static so that the exception handler can use it to write a ShadowException event. We can make the object non-static and have the exception logging code use the existing pointer myshadow_ptr to find the object. If myshadow_ptr is NULL, then it could write an error to the daemon log instead (there would be no current job to log an event for).
remarks: CODE_REVIEW : change looks good. version history needed.
